title: Drawing, Sheet, Model & Balloon Workflow
subtitle: Complete guide to the CAD/PLM documentation process

meta.title: Workflow Documentation - JBelt Doctor
meta.description: Complete guide to the Drawing, Sheet, Model, and Balloon workflow in JBelt Doctor CAD/PLM system

overview.title: Workflow Overview
overview.description: The JBelt Doctor system follows a structured workflow for managing CAD documentation. This process ensures proper organization, traceability, and integration with PTC Creo Parametric.
overview.tipDescription: Always follow the sequence: Drawings → Sheets → Models → Balloons & Notes for optimal organization and data integrity.

step1.title: Drawings Creation
step1.description: Drawings are the foundation of the documentation process. They represent the initial technical documentation created in PTC Creo Parametric.
step1.creoDescription: Automatically synchronized with PTC Creo Parametric via J-Link API for real-time updates

step2.title: Sheets Definition
step2.description: Sheets define the physical layout and format specifications for the drawings. They establish the canvas and formatting rules.
step2.associationDescription: Each sheet can be associated with multiple models through many-to-many relationships

step3.title: Models Management
step3.description: Models represent the 3D CAD objects and their relationships. They form the core engineering data structure.
step3.hierarchyDesc: Models support parent-child relationships for complex assemblies and sub-assemblies

step4.title: Balloons & Notes
step4.description: Balloons and notes provide annotations, callouts, and additional information on the drawings.

dos.title: Recommended Practices
dos.consistent: Use consistent naming conventions across all entities
dos.backup: Maintain regular backups of critical data

donts.title: Common Pitfalls to Avoid
donts.circular: Avoid circular references in model hierarchies
donts.inconsistent: Avoid inconsistent scale or format usage
